chef_bio: Vikas Khanna is an Indian chef, restaurateur, cookbook writer, filmmaker, humanitarian, and the judge of MasterChef India. He has been awarded the Michelin star for his restaurant, Junoon, in New York City.
cooking_method: Cook marinated chicken, then simmer in tomato puree, spices, and cream.

ingredients: potatoes, cauliflower, onion, tomato, cumin seeds
cooking_method: Saute cumin seeds, onion, and tomato, then add potatoes and cauliflower, cook until tender.

chef_bio: Sanjeev Kapoor is an Indian celebrity chef, entrepreneur, and television personality. He is best known for his cooking show, Khana Khazana, which is the longest running show of its kind in Asia.

cooking_method: Cook marinated chicken and rice separately, then layer and cook together.

chef_bio: Madhur Jaffrey is an Indian-born actress, food and travel writer, and television personality. She is known for her contributions to Indian cuisine and her cookbooks, such as 'An Invitation to Indian Cooking' and 'Madhur Jaffrey's Ultimate Curry Bible'.
ingredients: lamb, onion, tomato, yogurt, kashmiri red chili powder
cooking_method: Cook lamb in onion-tomato masala, then simmer in yogurt and spices.

cooking_method: Roast eggplant, then cook with onion, tomato, and spices.

cooking_method: Cook chicken in onion-yogurt masala, then simmer in cashew paste and spices.

chef_bio: Ranveer Brar is an Indian celebrity chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He has hosted several cooking shows, including 'The Great Indian Rasoi', 'Breakfast Xpress', and 'Snack Attack'.
ingredients: mixed vegetables, onion, tomato, pav bhaji masala, butter
cooking_method: Cook mashed vegetables in onion-tomato masala, serve with buttered bread.

chef_bio: Gaggan Anand is an Indian celebrity chef and owner of the restaurant, Gaggan, in Bangkok, Thailand. His restaurant has been named the best in Asia several times and he has been awarded two Michelin stars.
ingredients: chicken, yogurt, tandoori masala, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste
cooking_method: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices, then cook in a tandoor or oven.
